meanings.definition: To invest with a fee or fee simple.
meanings.sent1: The king enfeoffed the loyal knight with a piece of land.
meanings.sent2: She enfeoffed her son with the family estate.
meanings.sent3: The wizard enfeoffed the talking cat with the power of speech.
meanings.sent4: The teacher enfeoffed the students with knowledge like a magical gift.
meanings.sent5: The gardener enfeoffed the soil with nutrients, making the plants thrive.

meanings.definition: The granting of a fee or fee simple.
meanings.sent1: The enfeoffment of the property was a generous gift.
meanings.sent2: His enfeoffment of the title deed was a sign of trust.
meanings.sent3: The enfeoffment of the crown to the prince caused a stir in the kingdom.
meanings.sent4: The enfeoffment of the award symbolized recognition for her hard work.
meanings.sent5: The enfeoffment of the scholarship opened doors to new opportunities.
